Books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
Books.author: Harper Lee
Books.description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality, told through theeyes of a young girl in the Deep South.

Books.author: George Orwell
Books.description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society ruled by the Party, which has total control over every aspect of people's lives.

Books.title: The Great Gatsby
Books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Books.description: A story of the fabulously wealthy Jay Gatsby and his love for the beautifulDaisy Buchanan.

Books.title: Pride and Prejudice
Books.author: Jane Austen
Books.description: A romantic novel of manners that follows the character development ofElizabeth Bennet, the protagonist.

Books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
Books.author: J.D. Salinger
Books.description: A story about Holden Caulfield's experiences in New York City after being expelled from prep school.

Books.title: The Hobbit
Books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Books.description: A fantasy novel about the adventures of Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit, who sets out on a quest to win a share of a dragon's treasure.

Books.title: Fahrenheit 451
Books.author: Ray Bradbury
Books.description: A dystopian novel about a future society where books are banned, and 'firemen' burn any that are found.

Books.title: Moby-Dick
Books.author: Herman Melville
Books.description: The story of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to kill the white whale, Moby-Dick.

Books.title: War and Peace
Books.author: Leo Tolstoy
Books.description: A novel that chronicles the French invasion of Russia and the impact of theNapoleonic era on Tsarist society.

Books.title: The Odyssey
Books.author: Homer
Books.description: An epic poem that follows the Greek hero Odysseus on his journey home afterthe fall of Troy.

Books.title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
Books.author: Gabriel García Márquez
Books.description: The multi-generational story of the Buendía family in the mythical town of Macondo.

Books.title: Brave New World
Books.author: Aldous Huxley
Books.description: A dystopian novel envisioning a future society structured by genetic engineering and psychological conditioning.

Books.title: The Lord of the Rings
Books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Books.description: An epic high-fantasy novel following the quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.

Books.title: Don Quixote
Books.author: Miguel de Cervantes
Books.description: The story of an elderly man who, after reading too many chivalric romances, decides to become a knight-errant.

Books.title: The Divine Comedy
Books.author: Dante Alighieri
Books.description: An epic poem describing Dante's journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise.
